abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Beira Railway Project
            for Mozambique were as follows: outcomes were
            unsatisfactory; risk to development outcome was substantial;
            Bank performance was unsatisfactory and borrower performance
            was moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned
            includes: consider carefully the level of Government
            shareholdings in concessions. Though consideration was
            rightly given to the political and economic environment at
            the time of the concession, the Government of
            Mozambique's (GoM's) 49 percent stake in the
            concession created conflicting interests between the
            Government's roles of policy maker, regulator, and
            client on the one hand, and shareholder on the other.
            Consider effective regulatory body. This will help in
            limiting direct Government involvement in operations and
            focus the role of Government on regulatory control and
            policy making. Ensure clear separation between rail
            operations and infrastructure management. The Beira Railway
            Project might have had a different outcome if the links
            between the rail and port modes were clearly seen as part of
            an efficient logistics link targeting the major users.
